### {{< iconify simple-icons:revealdotjs >}} slides

::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="60%"}

`background-image` and `background-opacity` attributes ([as well as others](https://quarto.org/docs/presentations/revealjs/#slide-backgrounds)) can be added to slide title via [inline curly brackets]{.underline}:

```
## Hello, There {background-image="rainbowcat.jpg" background-opacity=".5"}

This presentation will show you...

```
:::

### {{< iconify vscode-icons:file-type-pdf2 >}} & {{< iconify devicon:html5-wordmark >}}

::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="25%"}

::: {.callout-note}

[Quarto extension](https://github.com/leovan/quarto-watermark) works well for both formats

:::

:::

::: {.column width="75%"}

```{r}
---
title: "Quarto Watermark Extension Example"
abstract: "This is an example document of quarto watermark extension."

filters:
  - watermark

watermark:
  text: "SAMPLE"     #<1> 
  size: 4            #<2> 
  angle: 45   
  color: "#444444"   
  opacity: 0.2       #<3> 
  cols: 1            #<4>
  rows: 1
  col-space: 10
  row-space: 10      #<4>
  z-index: 1            

format: pdf          #<5>
---

## Figure

![How qmd works](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/hello/images/rstudio-qmd-how-it-works.png)
```
1. change to whatever text you're interested in displaying
2. seems to carry most weight for (repeated vs solitary) display of watermark
3. ranges from 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque) -- desired effect will depend on color specification (line #12)
4. can be commented out (along with `size` on line #10) to reduce/enhance repeated effect
5. html or pdf equally effective -- not intended for typst documents
